instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hello, greetings to all.

I have a macbook air that won't turn on with the battery connected.

The voltage with the battery connected is 7.7v on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. (The battery has already been discarded.)

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> 3.39v

When it is connected to the source the voltage is 8.60V and it turns on normally.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Does it start with both charger and battery connected?
If yes, is the battery recognized and charging?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
the machine turns on without the battery, direct to the source.

When connecting the battery and the charger does not turn on.

If it charges and the battery is recognized.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
You've said machine doesn't turn on with charger and battery, both connected.
How is the battery recognized then?

Are you using original 45/60W Magsafe 2 charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: keyboard power button is bad. LOL
